intro: Galeopsis tetrahit subsp. glaucocerata, commonly known as blue hawksbeard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from June to August. Its leaves are lance-shaped, serrated, and often have a bluish-green hue due to a powdery coating. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
